result.execSummary:
The defendant MaryAnn Serrano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 2/8/2019, or serve 10 days in the House of Correction.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 26 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MaryAnn Serrano

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 26 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 2/8/2019, or serve 10 days in the House of Correction. 

Filed;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant MaryAnn Serrano in court with attorney Meera Lynn Al-Henaey.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant MaryAnn Serrano in court with attorney Meera Lynn Al-Henaey.  Defendant MaryAnn Serrano in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Status conference scheduled for January 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj

Attorney Paul J. Manley in court previously.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Southridge mall.

Defendant MaryAnn Serrano in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
